title: So I decided to give mid a shot
body: Or rather, I somehow got assigned mid a couple of times while choosing fill. All I have to say is, WHY is this the most popular role!?! It's stressful and it's hard! I fed, I may have cried a bit, I think I need to go lie down...

replies.body: I don't think it's most popular role anymore, nobody enjoys current mid meta, it's dominated by super-safe bullies like Zed or Lux, if you don't play something similar yourself, mid is terrible experience.

I used to play Orianna mid and I got my ball shoved up my {{champion:22}}  every game.  Now that I play zed mid, I'm rising the elo ladder!!

Really though, it's not hard to see why Zed is such a popular champion; he's so much fun to play.

The thing is, a good Orianna will DESTROY a good Zed. Between her ball harass and her shield (which can mitigate or even block his ult), Ori has the advantage.

You just need to punish the Zed for farming, ward, and ping MIA like crazy every time he disappears off the minimap.
But a good Zed won't get destroyed by Orianna
So just play yasuo, and destroy both

I find that there's quite a lot of expectations on mid players. They are basically expected to do almost everything (help jungler with ganks and objectives, win lane, deal damage, help peel, make plays, shot call, farm efficiently, control vision), and I think it's simply because they are in the middle, and have to most accessibility to the map in general, so they have the expectations of almost a 1-man team.

Well, mid is a lot of fun if you get a matchup consisting of two "fair" champions, where each can outplay the other to win.

Mid is no fun when you are pitted in an unfair matchup (e.g. mage vs manaless AD.)

Mid is kind of boring when you are against someone who does nothing but farm and run away (new Ahri comes to mind if she plays like that.)

How is it unfair when one specifically counters the other?
That's like saying it's unfair for someone to pick FIRE-type against a GRASS-type Pokemon dueler or whatever.

Because it's not fun when your game is decided by champion selection instead of by what you do in the game.

It's also against Riot's own design values:
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/dev-blog-design-values-league-legends

Uh, except that's not true at all.
Just because one counters another doesn't mean there's 0% chance of the countered one winning.
It just means the one that counters the other has an advantage.
Like with Pokemon, just because you're using GRASS-type and the enemy uses FIRE-type, it doesn't mean you have absolutely no chance of winning.
It just means it's going to be harder for you to do so because you're countered by the enemy.

I wouldn't really blame you that game, your team was absolute trash and the enemy team had 4 Ahri counters.

The ways in which Ahri can carry are 3:
- Teamfighter: group with your team, peel for your carries with charm and maybe rylais. Keep your team alive and they will win you the fight. Get picks with charm if possible. If there's nobody you can rely on, try to burst the enemy carries. I've won many games through peeling for my lategame Trist/Vayne/Twitch etc.
- Assassin: get blue trinket, spam it, ward everything. Find people that are alone, kill them. Only really works if you're fed, but as I see you do know how to get fed.
- Splitpushing: push lanes, take towers. When they send people after you, either escape with your kiting kit, or maybe kill them. Usually chasing an Ahri is just wasting time, you won't get her. Meanwhile your team gets objectives.

What I did in my screenshot was mostly the 2nd option, I was snowballing so hard I could oneshot anyone with W+R+ludens+lich bane. In the end I grouped with my team to push and got 2 picks with charm, then we pushed to nexus.
